alert.note: Alert for Lancaster; York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:11PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN LANCASTER AND SOUTHEASTERN YORK COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 607 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near White Horse to Holtwood to Stewartstown. Movement was very slowly south. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Very heavy rainfall may lead to localized flooding in poor drainage and urban areas. Locations impacted include... Paradise, Christiana, Quarryville, Stewartstown, Gap, Delta, Wakefield, and Shrewsbury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
